dcterms:creator: Catalin Ionescu
Dragos Papava
Vlad Olaru
Cristian Sminchisescu
dcterms:description: Human3.6M is the first ever large-scale dataset that uses motion capture equipment to track accurate 3D coordinates while a number of actors performing different daily life movements.
dcterms:title: Human3.6M

dcterms:creator: Weichen Zhang
Zhiguang Liu
Liuyang Zhou
Howard Leung
Antoni B Chan
dcterms:description: MADS is a dataset that includes movements in martial arts, dancing, and sports, developed using motion capture equipment on a smaller scale compared to Human3.6M.
dcterms:title: MADS

dcterms:creator: Shuhei Tsuchida
Satoru Fukayama
Masahiro Hamasaki
Masataka Goto
dcterms:description: AIST Dance++ is a high-definition dataset capturing dancing performances across multiple genres, utilizing algorithms for ground truth rather than markers.
dcterms:title: AIST Dance++

dcterms:creator: Dushyant Mehta
Helge Rhodin
Dan Casas
Pascal Fua
Oleksandr Sotnychenko
Weipeng Xu
Christian Theobalt
dcterms:description: MPI INF 3DHP is a 3D marker-based dataset that extends the classic 2D dataset MPII, providing additional data for human pose estimation.
dcterms:title: MPI INF 3DHP

dcterms:description: Humans7.1M is a novel dataset created by augmenting existing datasets to increase diversity and reduce noise, projected into a universal coordinate system.
dcterms:title: Humans7.1M
